findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability
findings.explanation: External call to `m_txs[_h].to.call.value(...)` is made before deleting the stored transaction (`m_txs[_h]`), allowing a recipient contract to re-enter and drain funds before state is cleared

findings.title: Denial Of Service vulnerability
findings.explanation: Unbounded loop over dynamic array m_pendingIndex in clearPending can consume unbounded gas. Since functions like changeOwner, addOwner, removeOwner, and changeRequirement call clearPending, a large m_pendingIndex will cause these to run out of gas and become unusable, resulting in a denial of service.

findings.title: Time Manipulation vulnerability
findings.explanation: The underLimit function uses today(), which relies on now (block.timestamp) to reset daily spending limits, allowing miners to manipulate the timestamp to bypass the daily limit.

findings.title: Short Addresses vulnerability

evidence.function: changeOwner, addOwner, removeOwner, setDailyLimit, resetSpentToday, kill, execute

findings.explanation: External functions that take address and/or uint arguments do not check msg.data.length, making them vulnerable to short address attacks.

findings.title: Other vulnerability
findings.explanation: Floating pragma version '^0.4.9' allows the use of different compiler patch versions, which may introduce inconsistent behavior.

vulnerability_location.description: External call to `m_txs[_h].to.call.value(...)` is made before deleting the stored transaction (`m_txs[_h]`), allowing a recipient contract to re-enter and drain funds before state is cleared

Unbounded loop over dynamic array m_pendingIndex in clearPending can consume unbounded gas. Since functions like changeOwner, addOwner, removeOwner, and changeRequirement call clearPending, a large m_pendingIndex will cause these to run out of gas and become unusable, resulting in a denial of service.
The underLimit function uses today(), which relies on now (block.timestamp) to reset daily spending limits, allowing miners to manipulate the timestamp to bypass the daily limit.

vulnerability_location.function: changeOwner, addOwner, removeOwner, setDailyLimit, resetSpentToday, kill, execute
vulnerability_location.description: External functions that take address and/or uint arguments do not check msg.data.length, making them vulnerable to short address attacks.
Floating pragma version '^0.4.9' allows the use of different compiler patch versions, which may introduce inconsistent behavior.
